channel.title: Gallery of Colour, Shape and Style
channel.description: Dedicated to bringing colours and shapes to the masses!

item.title: Sample Page
item.dc:creator: dnoma
item.content:encoded:
This is an example page. It's different from a blog post because it will stay in one place and will show up in your site navigation (in most themes). Most people start with an About page that introduces them to potential site visitors. It might say something like this:

Hi there! I'm a bike messenger by day, aspiring actor by night, and this is my website. I live in Los Angeles, have a great dog named Jack, and I like piña coladas. (And gettin' caught in the rain.)

...or something like this:

The XYZ Doohickey Company was founded in 1971, and has been providing quality doohickeys to the public ever since. Located in Gotham City, XYZ employs over 2,000 people and does all kinds of awesome things for the Gotham community.

As a new WordPress user, you should go to your dashboard to delete this page and create new pages for your content. Have fun!

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.dc:creator: dnoma
item.content:encoded:
Who we are

Our website address is: https://w7.senecawp.com.

What personal data we collect and why we collect it

Comments

When visitors leave comments on the site we collect the data shown in the comments form, and also the visitor’s IP address and browser user agent string to help spam detection.

An anonymized string created from your email address (also called a hash) may be provided to the Gravatar service to see if you are using it. The Gravatar service privacy policy is available here: https://automattic.com/privacy/. After approval of your comment, your profile picture is visible to the public in the context of your comment.

Media

If you upload images to the website, you should avoid uploading images with embedded location data (EXIF GPS) included. Visitors to the website can download and extract any location data from images on the website.

Contact forms

Cookies

If you leave a comment on our site you may opt-in to saving your name, email address and website in cookies. These are for your convenience so that you do not have to fill in your details again when you leave another comment. These cookies will last for one year.

If you visit our login page, we will set a temporary cookie to determine if your browser accepts cookies. This cookie contains no personal data and is discarded when you close your browser.

When you log in, we will also set up several cookies to save your login information and your screen display choices. Login cookies last for two days, and screen options cookies last for a year. If you select "Remember Me", your login will persist for two weeks. If you log out of your account, the login cookies will be removed.

If you edit or publish an article, an additional cookie will be saved in your browser. This cookie includes no personal data and simply indicates the post ID of the article you just edited. It expires after 1 day.

Embedded content from other websites

Articles on this site may include embedded content (e.g. videos, images, articles, etc.). Embedded content from other websites behaves in the exact same way as if the visitor has visited the other website.

These websites may collect data about you, use cookies, embed additional third-party tracking, and monitor your interaction with that embedded content, including tracking your interaction with the embedded content if you have an account and are logged in to that website.

Analytics

Who we share your data with

How long we retain your data

If you leave a comment, the comment and its metadata are retained indefinitely. This is so we can recognize and approve any follow-up comments automatically instead of holding them in a moderation queue.

For users that register on our website (if any), we also store the personal information they provide in their user profile. All users can see, edit, or delete their personal information at any time (except they cannot change their username). Website administrators can also see and edit that information.

What rights you have over your data

If you have an account on this site, or have left comments, you can request to receive an exported file of the personal data we hold about you, including any data you have provided to us. You can also request that we erase any personal data we hold about you. This does not include any data we are obliged to keep for administrative, legal, or security purposes.

Where we send your data

Visitor comments may be checked through an automated spam detection service.

Your contact information

Additional information

How we protect your data

What data breach procedures we have in place

What third parties we receive data from

What automated decision making and/or profiling we do with user data

Industry regulatory disclosure requirements

item.title: Front Page
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
WHAT TO SEE AND DO

The Gallery of CSS has a multitude of permanent installations. Here’s just a sample

Robotic Creatures of the Night. Explore the evolution of shapes and colours in the robot world. Laser eye cannons, gradient textures, mutating shapes and more!

Explore Nature. Colour is all around us. Natures palette has provided inspiration for artists throughout the ages. Come and see art and nature in our celebration of the colour wheel.

Shapes of the Future: Our state of the art facilities showcase interactive exhibits and hands on learning opportunities.

MORE INFORMATION TO MEET US

To experience the land of art, come visit 

Our doors are always welcome for our guests. Kindly follow the gallery timings for your visits.

Monday to Friday

10am to 6pm

Contact us for more information.

Weekends and Holidays

10am to 5pm

Contact us for more information.

OUR PROMINENT SHOWCASES

Portfolio

Gallery of Colours, Shapes and Styles displays a variety of work from artists across the globe.

View case study
Emotions

True desires of your heart

View case study
Wall Art

Facial expressions

View case study
Beauty

Hidding Beauty

View Portfolio
OUR AWESOME VISITORS

Visitor Testimonials

Don’t take our word for it – here’s what our visitors say:

Do you sometimes have the feeling that you’re running into the same obstacles over and over again? Many of my conflicts have the same feel to them, like “Hey, I think I’ve been here before,

John Doe

Styles Inc

Do you sometimes have the feeling that you’re running into the same obstacles over and over again? Many of my conflicts have the same feel to them, like “Hey, I think I’ve been here before,

John Doe

Stars and Planets

Do you sometimes have the feeling that you’re running into the same obstacles over and over again? Many of my conflicts have the same feel to them, like “Hey, I think I’ve been here before,

John Doe

Galaxy designs

Admission Fees

Adults    $12.00
Students and seniors   $10.00
Children (3-12)    $8.00
Children under 3    Free
Family (2 adults and 2 children)    $30.00

HOW TO REACH US

Getting here from

DOWNTOWN TORONTO

Take the Don Valley Parkway North to the 404 and exit at Highway 7, turn right and then left onto Allstate Parkway and turn left onto The Seneca Way.

FROM THE WEST

Take Highway 7, turn left onto Allstate Parkway and turn left onto The Seneca Way.

FROM THE NORTH

Take Highway 404 South to Highway 7. Exit at Highway 7, go east and then left onto Allstate Parkway and turn left onto The Seneca Way.

FROM THE EAST

Take Highway 7, turn right onto Allstate Parkway and turn left onto The Seneca Way.

item.title: About
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
About Us

The Gallery of Colour, Shape and Style opened in August 2016. Located at 1234 Art Nouveau Blvd. in Toronto's downtown core, we have established ourselves as Canada's first and foremost collector of all things colourful. Shades and tints abound in our exhibits, our colour palette consistently impresses and our monochromatic galleria soothes the senses. See our amazing colour wheel in the rotunda. Our primary and secondary colours are second to none! Visit our Tertiary Garden and relax in our forest of analogous colours and vector shapes.

The Gallery is essentially the result of Director Dr. Primary’s belief that she could make people more aware of the colours around us. In November 2014, she left her position as the senior curator at the Institute for Colour and dedicated herself to turning her vision into reality.

"Your attitude is like a box of crayons that colour your world. Constantly colour your picture grey, and your picture will always be bleak. Try adding some bright colours to the picture by including humour, and your picture begins to lighten up."

- Dr. Primary
Director of the Gallery

Gallery timeline

2016

  • August: Gallery opens to colourful reviews and applause, an indication of the shape of things to come!

2017

  • January: Approval of expansion plan is formally announced.
  • August: British curator Hugh Tertiary is hired. Expansion of the colour exhibits area continues.

2018

  • June: Special exhibit opens: A square peg in a round hole - hidden shapes all around us.
  • November 18: Our flagship exhibit: Coding Styles and the Pattern of Semantics, receives international acclaim!

2019

  • May 14: Gala opening of our new Hue/Saturation and Brightness café.

[soliloquy slug="image-carousel"]

item.title: WPForms
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
WPForms allows you to create contact forms, feedback form, subscription forms, payment forms, and other type of forms for your site in minutes. The pre-built form templates and workflows make it the most user friendly contact form plugin. They are highly optimized for the web and server performance.

I selected this form plugin as it is responsive in nature and goes well with the Mesmerize theme. The pre-built forms reduce the human effort as much as possible. The simple form design which I required was pre-built and hence, I didn't need any customization. I would definitely use this plugin for my future projects. It saves lot of time.

WPForms lets the user drag and drop required fields into the forms. Hence, it is extremely easy to embed it into WordPress sites.

item.title: Mesmerize theme
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
Mesmerize is an incredibly flexible, multipurpose WordPress theme that can help you create an amazing website easier than ever, by drag and drop. I have used the Free version of Mesmerize theme, which allows me to work with the Page Builder tool for the Home page. As it is a free version custom blocks cannot be used on rest of the pages.

I picked this theme as it is highly responsive in nature and there are over 60,000 active installations with a great support. Mesmerize theme looks great for the Gallery of Colours, Shape and Style as it supports image and shape overlay with a combination of gradient colour in the header area.

It was really easy to customize most of the content in the theme front-end. Designing the navigation bar is supported by this theme. However, the free version doesn't support Typography, Background colour and footer editing.

I might use this theme in future if I am not concerned about not having the Page builder tools on the inner pages. Typography, section background colour and footer editing too will be the points I would consider. Apart from that, I really liked this theme. It was easy to setup my pages and posts.

P.S:

I had first selected "Highlight" theme for this site. Highlight is the child theme of Mesmerize. However, I didn't go ahead with it as I couldn't create a child theme for it. As per the research it states that we cannot create a child theme for a child theme. This issue needs to be addressed using child plug-ins.

item.title: Soliloquy - Image Slider
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
Soliloquy Image slider plugin is a responsive plugin for having sliding images or the videos. They have 80,000+ active installations and the plugin was recently updated. This plugin is optimized for the web and server performance. We can get beautiful sliders using this plugin which looks great on any device.

I have used this plugin as it is responsive in nature. This plugin crops the images to the desired width and height automatically. Hence, manual photoshop effort can be dropped. I really liked this plugin. It was really easy to customize the slider size through the settings of the plugin. I have increased the height of the slider in this site. 

I think I will be using this plugin the future projects as it is easy to use and customize. It saves the manual photoshop effort for on images.

item.title: Plugin: TinyMCE Advanced
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
Plugin: TinyMCE Advanced

This plugin introduces the classic paragraph block for the block editor(Gutenberg). It is compatible with WordPress 5.3. Over 2+ million active installations and a regular updates makes this plugin a suitable one for changing the font-styles, text-color and other features.

The theme which I have used for this site is not flexible with respect to Typography and color styling in the free version. Hence, I have used TinyMCE Advanced in order to style this post uniquely when compared to the other posts in my site. I have also used this plugin to change the text color on the pages of this site except for the home page. It was easy to read the instructions present in the settings on this plugin and customize it for my website.

I would definitely use this plugin in my future projects if I had problems in playing around with Typography or color due to theme limitations.

This is the 1st testing for TinyMCE Advanced plugin. This plugin lets us create sub and super scripts as well.

TinyMCE Advanced provides a lot of other features too.

item.title: Hello world!
item.dc:creator: dnoma
item.content:encoded: Welcome to WordPress. This is your first post. Edit or delete it, then start writing!

wp:comment.wp:comment_content: Hi, this is a comment. To get started with moderating, editing, and deleting comments, please visit the Comments screen in the dashboard. Commenter avatars come from Gravatar.

item.title: Mesmerize Companion
item.dc:creator: srplatina
item.content:encoded:
This is the Page Builder Plugin which works with the theme Mesmerize. As the theme used for this website is a free version it supports only the front page(Home). It provides great styling for the front page with built-in features.

I got to know about this plugin as the theme customize option suggested about using it. It was a great experience working on this plugin. It provides drag an drop page building features. It has predefined content sections. As the theme is a free version this plugin doesn't support certain PRO features like typography, colors, PRO content sections and change of footer content etc.

I have used this plugin only on the home page (front-page) for creating the beautiful layout. I think I'll work with this plugin in the future only if I buy the PRO version of the theme. This could actually provide a lot more handy tools to work with.
